item.title: Susanne add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Susanne add a quote by James Branch Cabell
item.description: "The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true." -- James Branch Cabell

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "Idleness, like kisses, to be sweet must be stolen." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Stanley Kunitz
item.description: "The universe is a continuous web. Touch it at any point and the whole web quivers." -- Stanley Kunitz

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Honoré de Balzac
item.description: "The more one judges, the less one loves." -- Honoré de Balzac

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Though a good deal is too strange to be believed, nothing is too strange to have happened." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Gwendolyn Brooks
item.description: "Live not for Battles Won. Live not for The-End-of-the-Song. Live in the along." -- Gwendolyn Brooks

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you’re so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Susanne add a quote by E. B. White
item.description: "I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve (or save) the world and a desire to enjoy (or savor) the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E. B. White

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Jean de La Bruyère
item.description: "Those who make the worst use of their time are the first to complain of its brevity." -- Jean de La Bruyère

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If, then, I were asked for the most important advice I could give, that which I considered to be the most useful to the men of our century, I should simply say: in the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "Everybody hates me because I'm so universally liked." -- Peter De Vries

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld
item.description: "Absence diminishes small loves and increases great ones, as the wind blows out the candle and fans the bonfire." -- Francois Duc de la Rochefoucauld

item.title: Susanne add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Steve Jobs
item.description: "Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me." -- Steve Jobs

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Abraham Maslow
item.description: "To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail." -- Abraham Maslow

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Howard Thurman
item.description: "Whatever may be the tensions and the stresses of a particular day, there is always lurking close at hand the trailing beauty of forgotten joy or unremembered peace." -- Howard Thurman

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Robert Bly
item.description: "I am proud only of those days that pass in undivided tenderness." -- Robert Bly

item.title: Susanne add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you." -- Carl Sandburg
